description:
The Edo period is nearing its end. Gabimaru, a shinobi formerly known as the strongest in Iwagakure who is now a death row convict, is told that he will be acquitted and set free if he can bring back the Elixir of Life from an island that is rumored to be the Buddhist pure land Sukhavati. In hopes of reuniting with his beloved wife, Gabimaru heads to the island along with the executioner Yamada Asaemon Sagiri. Upon arriving there, they encounter other death row convicts in search of the Elixir of Life... as well as a host of unknown creatures, eerie manmade statues, and the hermits who rule the island. Can Gabimaru find the Elixir of Life on this mysterious island and make it back home alive?

(Source: Crunchyroll)
synonyms: สุขาวดีอเวจี

tags.name: Survival
tags.description: Centers around the struggle to live in spite of extreme obstacles.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Body Horror
tags.description: Features characters who undergo horrific transformations or disfigurement, often to their own detriment.

tags.name: Ninja
tags.description: Prominently features Japanese warriors traditionally trained in espionage, sabotage and assasination.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Samurai
tags.description: Prominently features warriors of medieval Japanese nobility bound by a code of honor.

tags.name: Battle Royale
tags.description: Centers around a fierce group competition, often violent and with only one winner.

tags.name: Historical
tags.description: Partly or completely set during a real period of world history.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Religion
tags.description: Centers on the belief that humanity is related to supernatural, transcendental, and spiritual elements.

tags.name: Travel
tags.description: Centers around character(s) moving between places a significant distance apart.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Gods
tags.description: Prominently features a character of divine or religious nature.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Gender Bending
tags.description: Prominently features a character who dresses and behaves in a way characteristic of another gender, or has been transformed into a person of another gender.

tags.name: Fugitive
tags.description: Prominently features a character evading capture by an individual or organization.

tags.name: Martial Arts
tags.description: Centers around the use of traditional hand-to-hand combat.

tags.name: Death Game
tags.description: Features characters participating in a game, where failure results in death.

tags.name: Cultivation
tags.description: Features characters using training, often martial arts-related, and other special methods to cultivate qi (a component of traditional Chinese philosophy, described as "life force") and gain strength or immortality.

tags.name: Crime
tags.description: Centers around unlawful activities punishable by the state or other authority.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Cult
tags.description: Features a social group with unorthodox religious, spiritual, or philosophical beliefs and practices.

tags.name: Orphan
tags.description: Prominently features a character that is an orphan.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Bisexual
tags.description: Features a character who is romantically or sexually attracted to people of more than one sex or gender.

tags.name: Cannibalism
tags.description: Prominently features the act of consuming another member of the same species as food.

tags.name: Cosmic Horror
tags.description: A type of horror that emphasizes human insignificance in the grand scope of cosmic reality; fearing the unknown and being powerless to fight it.

tags.name: Amnesia
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) with memory loss.

node.description:
Yuuji Kaku was previously an assistant to [Tatsuki Fujimoto](https://anilist.co/staff/119917/Tatsuki-Fujimoto). He once worked as an editor at Akita Shoten. His cousin is the actor and singer [Takeshi Tsuruno](https://anilist.co/staff/111537/Takeshi-Tsuruno).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ug_kaku)
A Japanese arranger, composer, and member of the band [Jyukai](https://anilist.co/staff/100234/Jyukai).

[Website](https://millenniumparade.com/)

**millennium parade** is a creative group involving various artists, including [Daiki Tsuneta](https://anilist.co/staff/158731), [Kazuki Arai](https://anilist.co/staff/183237) and Yuu Seki of [King Gnu](https://anilist.co/staff/157033), [ermhoi](https://anilist.co/staff/158733), Kento Nagatsuka and Ayatake Ezaki of WONK and more.

Ringo Shiina is a Japanese singer, songwriter and musician. She is also the founder and frontwoman of the band Tokyo Jihen.

She describes herself as "Shinjuku-kei Jisaku-Jien-ya (新宿系自作自演屋, a Shinjuku-style writer-performer)". She was ranked number 36 in a list of Japan's top 100 musicians compiled by HMV in 2003.

Shiina is an accomplished musician and songwriter who writes music spanning numerous genres. She is well known for her eccentricity, rolling her "r"s and creating promotional music videos with striking visuals. She mainly plays rhythm guitar, but she plays other musical instruments. During live shows she sometimes plays the piano and occasionally plays the bass guitar. While recording, she sometimes plays piano and drums, and occasionally uses uncommon musical instruments such as a melodica and a shamisen.

[Site](https://mizuki110.studio.site/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/mizito110)


Mizuki Itou grew up in Nara, Japan and currently based in Kyoto.

He studied digital animation independently while attending a design school. During this time he also began participating in local TV animation productions as a (key) animator.

After graduating, he continued to work intermittently as an animator, but also began producing his own works independently, aiming for a more personal expression not limited to only entertainment.

Based on a script by his mentor, director Hideto Nakata (SOVAT THEATER), Mizuki handled the direction, character designs, storyboards, animation, sounds, and editing of his first film "Takano Intersection".

Going forward, Mizuki plans to focus on producing his own original works. He is currently working on his next animation project.

(Source: Biography page on Mizuki Ito's website)
